message: Currently I use a macmini hooked up to my tv and I alt-tab between boxee & hulu desktop while watching netflix on the xbox.  Obviously this is not an ideal solution… wondering if plex can fix that.  Claims to support netflix and hulu.
Seems to be another multiplatform XBMC based media center interface.  http://plexapp.com
i haven't tried the Hulu support but Netflix works pretty well in it

There's a new app coming out called Squire that's supposed to take the headaches out of managing your video sources and content. They send out invites to their Alpha fairly often, so maybe sign up and give it a shot: http://www.squireapp.com/
I used it for a while and it wasn't bad. Managing your different video sources was a real pain, though – especially when it came to the app recognizing newly added video files.
The UI is definitely overcomplex, I only ever use 3 filters per Movies/TV out of like 100
But it's also by far more performant at playing high definition movies than anything else out there
I've been using Plex for a long time, Plex9 is pretty nice
That's why I keep going back to it, it's the only app that can handle playing 1080p back on my older MBP

I use Plex on a daily basis. But one thing I find particularly annoying is the settings and navigation interface. For instance, in Boxee I could easily navigate through menus using arrows and Enter keys (or the remote of my iMac) to delay subtitles. In Plex, I have to memorize and use obscure keyboard shortcuts. Which never seem to work, anyway.

This weekend I went and installed Plex on my media center mac mini.  It did a good job with picking up all the media from my drobo.  The hulu and netflix applications also work well.  However my biggest complaint is that I pretty much always want the "Video Plug-Ins" menu to be the main screen.  Also the Plex Media Server seems … slow.   I spend a lot of time waiting for it to do things like let me see what's in my hulu queue.
